response: "I can't keep up with everyone's expectations. It's like I'm constantly drowning in this sea of perfection that I can never reach."
"Why does society make me feel like I have to be flawless in every aspect? I'm tired of pretending to have it all together when inside I'm falling apart."
"I feel like I'm losing myself in this never-ending quest for perfection. It's like I've become a puppet, constantly trying to meet society's unrealistic standards."
"Everywhere I look, I see people who seem to have it all figured out. Meanwhile, I'm struggling to even comprehend what 'perfect' really means."
"I'm starting to question my own worth because I don't fit into society's mold of what a perfect person should be. It's driving me crazy."
